Comment: Context: in most commonwealth nations this holiday is known as armistice day or remembrance day in reference to the armistice that ended world war 1. Many of those who served in that era are what’s referred to as the “lost” and “silent generation” for the amount of suffering that was endured and the new era of warfare it ushered in with it. Comment: Requires an act of Congress…  “By 1954, however, the United States had been involved in two other military engagements: World War II and the Korean War. Instead of creating additional federal holidays to commemorate each war, Congress felt it would be better to commemorate the sacrifices of all American veterans on a single day. On June 1, 1954, the name of Armistice Day was officially changed to Veterans Day.24 This legislation did not establish a new holiday. Rather, it broadened the "significance of an existing holiday in order that a grateful nation, on a day dedicated to the cause of world peace, may pay homage to all of its veterans." “  - from congress.gov
